properties.what_was_t: Old dock

properties.name: Ian Winn
properties.what_was_t: scows used for the transport of materials
properties.estimate_t: each one about the size of a wood chip barge
properties.describe_t: scows have been at this location for many months. Owner is known by community members, but can 't be contacted.  Condition of scows is deteriorating rapidly and one is now partially sunk. Contents in scow unknown.
properties.additional:
scows are located in partially sheltered bay but could break away in a bad storm. Especially a storm from the northwest or northeast (Squamish winds)
Contact - Ian Winn (604)989-3337
properties.height_abo: some of the scows are partially sunk.
properties.can_you_pr: No, I cannot provide a picture
properties.do_you_hav: Yes, I can answer a few more qu
properties.please_spe: Scows are tied up to a floating dock structure that may be unstable. Scows are listing and partially sunk. Proceed with caution.

properties.name: Susan Bartlett
properties.what_was_t: This item is a derelict old dock with concrete, wood, and very large block of styrofoam, which are breaking off into smaller components
properties.estimate_t: Approximately 5 meters x 5 meters x 2 meters
properties.estimate_1: We found it September 29 but I believe its been floating off the southwest coast of Gambier for about a month.  Last night it was about 100 meters north of where I found it this morning. month.
properties.describe_t: The item is currently just south of the long blue and white jetty /dock on the south end of Burgess Cove.  As mentioned, however, the item moved south last night. Clearly, the high tides at this time our facilitating its movement around the area..
properties.additional: Access would be via private property
properties.please_e_1: This could be a navigational hazard when floating
properties.can_you_pr: Yes, I already have an image sa
properties.do_you_hav: Yes, I can answer a few more qu

properties.name: Kent Friesen
properties.what_was_t: It is a commercial barge that has partially capsized but appears to still be partially floating
properties.estimate_t: The barge is approximately 100 feet long
properties.additional: Feel free to contact me at 604-240-5843
properties.height_abo: Currently still below high tide, but appears beached
properties.untitled_q: Rock shore, not cliffs but also not beach. Gradual entry
properties.ha_other: Affected by weather. Very exposed to the south. Partially capsized vessel so may be unstable?
properties.please_ela: I observed no evidence of injured or killed marine life at this point.
properties.please_e_1: It is close to an area of multiple mooring bouys, recreational swimming and water activity. It could drift closer to this area and become more dangerous.
properties.can_you_pr: Yes, I already have an image sa

properties.please_des: Styrofoam breaking into small pieces that will Neve r be recovered unless someone acts now.
properties.please_ela: Rusting steel , both items are the styrofoam that breaks easily into small pieces
properties.please_e_1: One piece is a large concrete enclosed styrofoam dock the other is a steel encased piece of styrofoam. Both are heavy enough a single person has no chance to move. If a small struck either it could quite possibly sink boat

properties.name: Robert Allan
properties.what_was_t: This debris was deliberately placed on NE corner of Bowyer Island app.3 years ago by Mercury Water taxi (or Mercury Tug & Barge?), and we have always assumed this was debris collected in Horseshoe Bay and removed under contract.
properties.estimate_1: a cluster of timbers and float logs and a portion of old dock
properties.describe_t: NE corner of Bowyer Island
properties.additional:
This submission is being made on behalf of Bowyer Island Estates Ltd, the property owner.
This report tool is great, although the questions might be a bit limiting.
While strictly speaking this "dump" might not fit the mold for most marine debris in comm
properties.can_you_pr: Yes, I already have an image sa
properties.field_55_o: As this material was "dumped' onto private land it does pose a risk to our natural environment
properties.do_you_hav: Yes, I can answer a few more qu
properties.please_spe: the debris is loosely piled on a fairly steep rocky shoreline where access is difficult. Caution must be exercised by anyone going ashore.

properties.name: Lea Hansen
properties.what_was_t: All debris noted is in Andys Bay west side of Gambier Island. It has been there for years and the ferry for two years now. All the rusting is polluting the water from the old barge etc.
properties.describe_t: The blue arrow is not functioning. Andy bay is well marked on charts. The debris is obvious.
properties.please_e_1: As it is obvious debris boaters would not run into it but destroying the waters with the pollution.

properties.name: Ryan Allderman
properties.estimate_t: Most likely a long piece of steel cable, at least a few meters long, 4cm think
properties.estimate_1: Single old rusty steel cable, mostly buried
properties.describe_t: On the remains of the spit road, in the lower rocky section to the right of center looking out.
properties.height_abo: The cable is exposed at around 1.6m tide.
properties.please_e_1:
The cable is very sharp at the end, people walk on the old spit road when it is submerged so someone could easily injure themselves on this old rusty cable.
I have put a hole in my foot before on a similar cable at Nexan beach (I removed it).

properties.name: Ruth Simons
properties.what_was_t: Purposeful sinking, John says holes drilled into the hull
properties.estimate_1: John says fuel tanks are full with diesel
properties.describe_t: I don't have exact coordinates, but John Buchanan has photos and it is in the marine park
properties.additional: John has spoken to Porteau Cove parks supervisor, they don't know what to do. Spoken with Coast Guard who have deemed it not be a risk, but John argues that fuel on board does pose a risk to those climbing on it, He continues to call.  Next step is to co
properties.please_e_1: John says the boat is underwater at high tide, but low tides kids are playing on it.

properties.name: Davina Dibe
properties.what_was_t: John Buchanan trying to do something about it but not getting anywhere with authorities. Can you help?
properties.describe_t: Someone attempted to sink a boat (bullet holes in bow). It washed up in Porto Cove Marine park. Parks, Coast guard, rcmp are not doing anything about it. Fluids have leaked at this point. John Buchanan has been trying to get this resolved but nothing
properties.do_you_hav: No, thanks! I'll submit now!

properties.name: Stewart Prockter
properties.estimate_t: multiple10 metre creosoted 12" x 12" beams. large tarp', plywood, all interconnected with protruding spikes and other hardware.
properties.describe_t: North of step access to Baker Beach. Only partially onshore so at risk of refloating on high tide.
properties.additional: Debris has already moved from adjacent beach on Bowen, and seems likely to move again. This debris would pose a serious risk to marine traffic if it reenters Howe Sound. local beachcombers and professional scavengers have stated they would be unable to m
properties.height_abo: at and below high tide line
properties.please_ela: Heavily creosoted debris. strong smell of creosote and or gasoline or similar chemical. Also. possible risk of entanglement with attached tarpaulin.
properties.please_e_1: Debris presently on a quiet, but public, beach, posing safety hazard to visitors. Debris is still partially afloat and has already moved from adjacent beach on Bowen Island. This is several tons of debris which may refloat on high tides.
properties.do_you_hav: Yes, I can answer a few more qu
properties.please_spe: Rocky setting. steep land access. likely need for heavy lifting equipment, barge and crane! Several tons of interconnected debris.

properties.name: Teresa Benoit

properties.additional: A smashed up 3-man dinghy is also stuck in that same cove so it would be great if you could come and get that too if possible?? ( I included a photo of the dinghy.) Let me know thanks!! Call me at 7788997316  or  email me at: treebee1986@gmail.com  if an
properties.height_abo: I would say it is only 1 feet above high tide?
properties.debris_a_1: It is a shoreline, but  I don't know if it is sheltered or exposed sorry! It is easy to get to, but it definitely requires a  boat. The road is not at all nearby.
properties.field_61_o: 275 Gallon IBC TANK (must have fallen off a freighter)
